column2: shopper, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Combigan completely knocks me out within 40 minutes. I have switched to taking it at night, because Isaac unable to function.  I try to take it at 9pm. Then at midnight. Then if I wake up, once more no later than  4am. I take the lumigan in the late morning.  This is better than taking connivance in the day. However I wake up hungover. But it's better than falling asleep in my office.

column2: Ana, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: My doctor tried several medications and this one worked the best, and I didn't have an allergic reaction as I did with some of the other ones.

column2: eternal perspective, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Xalatan and Alphagan for over 15 yrs. I recently changed doctors and because the pressure was at 30, Azopt and Combigan were started. It's been two months and I've felt terrible. On the positive side the pressure came down to 20. In the past, medication would bring it down to 24. I'm experiencing severe fatigue through the day. There is muscle weakness that I've never had before. I get very thirsty. My eye is sore and feels like something is it and the vision more blurred. At my last visit I was able to discontinue the Azopt thinking that was the one causing the problems. I don't feel any better and have a month before I go back for a pressure check. I'm at the place now that I would rather risk losing my sight than to put up with these side effects. I am becoming much more of a recluse because of lack or energy and motivation since being on these medications.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Detached Retina resulting in 3 surgeries and increased pressure in eye. Multiple surgeries resulted in development of cataract within 7 months of detached retina. Cataract surgery and lens replacement. I found combigan to be a great help. My pressure has been as high as 44 and has been averaging 14 at this time.  I can not identify any side affects that could be specific to combigan because I also have hypo-thyroid. Possible side affects I have been experiencing: depression, anxiety, hair loss.

column2: grandma, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Taking combigan 2 X day for 2 months. Prescription has been working eye pressure went down fro, 47 to 23. Feel tired for 2-3 hrs. Have to lay down and sometimes can not focus and nausea. column2: skier, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: have used drug for over 1 year, achieved substantial drop in pressure (18 to 10) with no side effects,it has worked wonders for me!!!

column2: So Tired, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: 13Spikes, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Cons: I am weak, sluggish, tired and sleepless with a stomach ache. The drops burn on application and give me red eyes. Pros: There is no more migraine pain, even though I get all of the symptoms. It lowered my eye pressure greatly, but I have lost quite a bit of weight even though already thin. I worry that the stomach is getting worse, or causing a new problem.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been so exhausted since starting this drug. It was very hard to lift my arms and legs when I first started Combigan one month ago. I am nauseous, dizzy, depressed and my hair is falling out. I have thin hair to begin with, but my today my husband even commented how thin my hair has gotten. My doctor has suggested lazer surgery. Haven't decided what to do.

column2: vj, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column9: I have been taking this drug for one month and have not had any noticable side effects. After one week the drug lowered my eye pressure from 38 to 24. So far, this drug has worked for me.

column9: Horrible experience, swelling and tingling in feet (some type of neuropthy)  took it for 1 months and it has been five months off and I am still getting over the reaction

column2: Phil, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am in training for a marathon and after starting this medication, my pace decreased considerable and I am ravaged by tiredness, yet I haven´t been sleeping that well at night.  The tiredness has affected my job and life in general.  Have reduced my dosage to one drop at night. will see how that works.

column2: Usingmac1, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have a heart condition. The drug was causing my eyes to get "pink" and very watery. Also I could not walk 1/5th mile before I got a slight, funny feeling in my lower throat and I didn't want to continue my walk. Saw my cardiologist and he arranged for a nuclear test which was abnormal. He prescribed nitro pills to take when I had that feeling. (Also catherization to which I said No.) After 4 months my eyes were getting more "pink" so I stopped taking Combigan for 4 days and I could walk OK for 2 miles. I think there is a causation beween Combigan and  irritation of heart problem. Seeing my Cardiologist tomorrow. (As an aside, I was instructed to place one drop in each eye before blocking teat duct area. I can see how that would allow part of first drop to enter one tear duct and get into my system before I applied a drop to the second eye.)  J.M.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After two days on Combigan, I had shortness of breath, dry mouth, was extremely tired and felt "drugged" - then I realized it was the eye drops making me feel so bad.  I had no idea an eye drop could affect a person in such a serious way.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: About 1 hour after putting drops in the eyes, I fall asleep for about 2 hours if I am sitting in a chair.  If I am not home, I feel an overwhelming fatigue.  Also my mouth and throat are extremely dry and I have had laryngitis ever since beginning this drug 9 months ago.  I am going to ask my doctor to prescribe something else - the side effects have made me so tired I can't function.  My eye pressures, however, have gone from 48 to 16.
